Inference: The fairness of a six-sided die is determined by whether each number (1 through 6) has an equal probability of being rolled. To test this, we need to observe the frequency of each number in a large enough sample size. The larger the sample size, the closer we get to the true probability.

However, rolling the dice 6 times may not be enough to detect a bias since the sample size is small. Rolling the dice 1000 times increases the chances of detecting any bias.

Final Answer: Roll the dice 1000 times and make note of each roll. Find out if any number or numbers appeared more often by adding the number of times a number came up.
